website_summaries.verdict: Quality craftsmanship and lightweight carbon fiber construction make this tank an all-around good choice.
pros: and T.C.- approved carbon fiber bottle
You also receive Allen key with extra bolt
cons: Threads are a bit delicate and may be difficult for new players to operate

customer_reviews.title: otherwise it would have been a great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it is not amazingly clear here that this version does not support PCP air rifles; otherwise it would have been a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Noor

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, returned two...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two tanks, first one has screws issue and the second one is leaking... I returned both tanks. The weird thing is that i received two tanks of diferant size !!! I will not buy tanks from amzon anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Whocares

customer_reviews.title: Happy HPA Gunna
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, fresh just born hydro date. This tank looks and feels great no complaints here almost too light wieghs nothing at all maybe one pound empty less then two full. Regulator is nice and noticed some newer tech now with the double o rings and nice small gauge faces, very sharp. Over all impressed with this well made product. Any changes in performance or reliability I will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Much better than aluminum. Not cheap, but with the cost in weight savings.
customer_reviews.text: Looks ad feels like quality. Filled once, still holding pressure. Mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ryan

customer_reviews.title: The color looks great, Ninja has great customer service
customer_reviews.text: After watching and reading lots of reviews I bought this tank. The color looks great, Ninja has great customer service, and the tank is fantastic. I love how I can get tighter to my ego and still be using a 68. It is a mix between a normal 68 and a peanut tank.
customer_reviews.author: RWB

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight tank with less refills.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the all day Paintball game. It's not heavy like my other tanks.
customer_reviews.author: D Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Why did I ever doubted you.... I need a bigger tank for scenario
customer_reviews.author: DAN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tank, perfect size and proportions for adult, blue looks stunning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very light looks good works well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well exactly what I need it great carbon fiber colors high-quality will see how long it lasts so far so good very nice will buy again
customer_reviews.author: sosa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect tank. Its really small and light. Hold enough air for a good game. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Andy The One

customer_reviews.title: Great Tank At A Great Cost!
customer_reviews.text: Great tank, very light, and looks awesome. Of course air doesn't come with it (very dangerous to ship) and also you get a allen key with a extra bolt. Fits great on my ego and feels great on my gun. Everything feels balanced out because the tank definitely distributes its weight. Ninja Tanks are made in the USA which is why i bought this tank in particular. Has a 5 year Hydro date and comes with a free protective cap. At the cost i paid for it used, it's a must have! Also you get a ninja paintball sticker :)
customer_reviews.author: iCashtro

customer_reviews.title: Typical Ninja Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few Ninja Tanks and they are all high quality made HPAs! The regs are always top-notch and they are pressure user-adjustable as usual. This little booby tank is light and you almost forget you have it on.
customer_reviews.author: DirtRaven

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tank
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, durable and looks good. I havent had any problems with this tank at all but i did break a reg on my last ninja tank( my fault) ninja customer service is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Marcin M. Matula

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tank for the money
customer_reviews.text: User adjustable pressure so you can set it for what you like. Almost a year usage and is very reliable and consistent regulator. The regulator is just the right length, not to short like the myth. I've used this on my Ego11, DM 9, 10 & 12, Luxe, Rail, Autococker and a MacDev Clone GT and were all consistent. Tuning your marker will make it more reliable and consistent and don't just rely on the tank. One reviewer asked how many shots from the 68/45k. This will vary from marker to marker. Poppits like an Ego will yield a bit more shots per fill than a spoolie like a DM. But generally I get about 1600 - 1800 per fill.
customer_reviews.author: DirtRaven

customer_reviews.title: ... a reminder that this a small tank it fits good and does what it said it would
customer_reviews.text: Just a reminder that this a small tank it fits good and does what it said it would. Not the v2 reg though.
customer_reviews.author: alexander sweetwine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my 16 year old son was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: LynMarie

customer_reviews.title: Carbon fiber and Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: Now I have a lot of foreign made items like my toyota truck but when I can find a superior product thats made on our soil, I buy it. Thats what your doing here when you buy this hi performance tank.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and looks good! Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Filled it pre-game, played 3 hours and didn't have to refill once. Light weight and looks good! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for speedball
customer_reviews.text: Tank works quite well. HPA gauge is inaccurate by 500 psi but other than that, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great tank. I've had absolutely no problems with it. Please realize this is a big tank though. I saw this tank and thought it was a great deal to get a 90ci for $160 when a 68ci is $150. I would recommend saving the 10 dollars and getting the smaller tank unless there's a reason you need the bigger tank. My field has all day free air so there was no point getting the bigger tank. It honestly is so big that it hurt my wrist last time I played. Still a great tank from ninja and couldn't recommend their carbon fiber tanks more.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Frymire

customer_reviews.title: Great Tank
customer_reviews.text: Works and no leaks, what else could I ask for? Super light too and I'm a fan of the stubby design, works better for me on the field.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: The best there is and no one can argue that
customer_reviews.text: Ninja need I say more. The best there is and no one can argue that.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Zovishlack

customer_reviews.title: Tank is nice but as soon as I received the tank out ...
customer_reviews.text: Tank is nice but as soon as I received the tank out of the box the regulator and other components where scratched up surprised and dissatisfied because the description said new and it looks used.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra Fayziyev

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed tank! Item came with no flaws out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: nam_i_am

customer_reviews.title: Good tank
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, it does its job as advertised^
customer_reviews.author: Gareth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came as described, really wish my birth date was newer. It was from 2014.
customer_reviews.author: curtis72

customer_reviews.title: Carbon for the win!
customer_reviews.text: This tank is just the right size for when playing on fields where they don't have 4500 PSI near all the courses, and I've never had to think twice about playing another round as a result. Slightly lighter than a 48 cu steel, and holds far more air - nothing to worry about with this tank at all! Highly recommended - worth the extra spend to get carbon for sure.
customer_reviews.author: P. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Love it and use it as my back up Shipped very quick and I saved money from my local shop so Win Win Win get it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Best Tank on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Best Tank I have ever used. Crazy Light weight. Perfect size Note... I returned mine though because the regulator came rusted out of the box and would not fill properly. The tank must have been stored in a humid environment. I ended up ordering at a local store so I could check out the reg first before I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My first tank was a Guerilla aluminum 68ci 3k aluminum. Upgrading to this, lighter, higher potential capacity, shorter and fatter profile. Feels better both attached to the marker and in the back of my vest rig.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Silva

customer_reviews.title: You will need one eventually
customer_reviews.text: So much better then a 48/3000 I fill up every two to three games and it makes a good sized stock- I have long arms I'm a bigger guy l- but for the amount of air it's worth it for the long drawn out matches
customer_reviews.author: Scott Smethers

customer_reviews.title: This tank is the real deal 5*
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my tippmann 98custom act platinum series with a response trigger and cyclone feed system so you know i shoot alot and this tank fits the perfect need for that the only thing that bothers me is how heavy it is but then again am a lazy short person.
customer_reviews.author: alfredo

customer_reviews.title: great tank
customer_reviews.text: Tank is a little short for me, but they all are. I reccomend this tank and it gets delivered fast. Great reg on the tank too. Get it. Used on my DM12
customer_reviews.author: bryce

customer_reviews.title: nice tank
customer_reviews.text: Like the color of this tank above the plain old black. Can't get it to fill beyond 4000 but may just be the filling machine am using. Ninja is made in the usa and a popular tank brand with some customizable features beyond my understanding. Size is good to carry on back but the 90CI is probably a little too big to carry on marker. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Richardson

customer_reviews.title: I like the tank but I am curious to find out ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the tank but I am curious to find out why there is a bump in the form of a nipple on bottom of air tank I will find out tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Banks-Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great tank
customer_reviews.text: I got this tank and really love it. It feels good and is much lighter than traditional metal tanks. I do, however, have one reservation to this; I should have gone with the 50ci model. Right now, with a 68ci model, you can go almost 3 - 4 full games with one tank. That's great for scenario, but I am preferential to speedball more frequently. I love the tank, but get the 50ci if you can, it will really save you a ton of weight in the long run (the short run too).
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: This make the gun much more easy to use and shoot
customer_reviews.text: Is the right size air tank for you if your using a Tippman A5. Is known to be a air hog but with this tank i can now shoot about 900 paint balls before i could only do about 500 to 600 with a 3k 77 tank. I do use a remote line and carry the tank in a pod pack holder. This make the gun much more easy to use and shoot. If not its just way to heavy and your arms will be very sore very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Love this tank looks good functions great but
customer_reviews.text: Love this tank looks good functions great but... Blew a burst disk after about 15 games. Simple fix but still
customer_reviews.author: Sidney McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Ninja is the best!
customer_reviews.text: Ninja Paintball makes the best tanks out there! This tank is so tiny, but still holds enough air to get thru several games. Very well made and Ninja's customer service is top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This product didn't serve my purposes. It has a hard time filling up and for new players it's really difficult to operate. The threads are extremely delicate and don't attach very well without a lot of time making sure it's good. I wouldn't buy this again, look at different companies for your HPA. Mine had an issue with shipping, but I purchased it locally at my local paintball store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Build quality and craftsmanship are stellar. Looks bad ass. Item appeared to be new in original box but when I took it to my friends store for filling, the operator told me it was used, judging by the thread wear and worn o rings. So that was kind of a bummer. Gauge meter isn't very reliable or accurate when your filling a tank meant for 6000psi at 3000psi (our pump's max output). I still use it today but would recommend buying it new unopened, from a reputable dealer, cover the threads, and fill it at a big boys shopbto reach its full operating potential.
customer_reviews.author: WhiskeyHotel

customer_reviews.title: So Far...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this tank abut a week ago. I was having trouble finding a place that would fill the tank near me but I found one yesterday. I have not shot my gun (Etek 3 AM) yet with this tank. I am very happy with the tank so far. I would definitely recommend it to someone else. Make sure you have a place to fill the tank up first and make sure they fill to 4500 psi because most of the time only fields fill that high and right now the fields near me are closed. If i would have known this I would have gotten 2 3000 psi tanks for 80 less dollars.
customer_reviews.author: sandling22

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: ninja paintball 68/4500 is top of the line product. have no problems with it at all!!!!!!!!!!! i suggest this product to all paintball fans out there!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Another awesome product from Ninja Paintball
customer_reviews.text: I have replaced my Ninja Paintball 48/3000 Aluminum HPA Air System with this one. And there is a big difference. First of all its lighter and Second capacity is 68/4500 which allows you to shoot up to 45% more. Awesome product definetly recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Lantis

customer_reviews.title: Fill nipple placement
customer_reviews.text: So 1st thing I did when I got this tank was screwed it onto my gun and... The fill nipple is dead center in my wrist :( so talked to some people who have the same tank and found a simple solution and that's to put a tank oring into the Asa as that will offset the fill nipple enough to where its not painfully placed
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking tank
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my son and he loved it, until we filled it and something broke. Had to return it, but my son wants another of the same so I guess this is a good tank :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ninja is now my preferred tank provider......
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my Empire tank because I have had a few issues with the quality of their tanks. I could have saved lots of money by buying Ninja to begin with. I absolutely love this tank, after about a dozen uses there doesn't seem to be any quality issues that I was getting with the Empire tanks and I still get equivalent performance.
customer_reviews.author: Chafner_0711

customer_reviews.title: Ninja 68/4500
customer_reviews.text: Got my 68/4500/Ninja tank today. Came with a 1/16 hydro so plenty of life on it. Even came with instructions for it. Can't wait to get it on the field!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S

customer_reviews.title: Decent tank lightweight but the full nipple doesn't work with ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent tank lightweight but the full nipple doesn't work with any coupling I have so I had to buy a regular Nipple
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Kent

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tank
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty light weight but the tank came with a small leak where the pressure gauge is ...had to tighten up and it was fine....though it doesn't keep air pressure as long as I think it should
customer_reviews.author: Leviticus Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Durable and light.
customer_reviews.text: Filled at 4500 psi, the tank weighs about 5 pounds, give or take. making it easy to hold a tank capable of firing 700+rounds without the weight of a steel tank. also turns a few heads with the paintball nerds. ;P
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Using this tank for an Airsoft HPA setup (P* Jack) - Performs exceptionally well so far - 2k rounds. I bought this primarily for the weight. I believe it's a hair over 2lbs. I was using an aluminum 62/3000 Valken tank before that would kill my back in MILSIM and CQB.
customer_reviews.author: V.

customer_reviews.title: Watch out DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: Defective tank used it 3 times on the 4th time it was leaking air from the regulator.
customer_reviews.author: DoD GOON

customer_reviews.title: Quality tank!
customer_reviews.text: This tank is really great. I dont want to knock a star off for being too small...but since most paintball parks do not fill up the tank completely, I have always struggled with keeping enough air while going past the second round of a match. If you shoot lots of paint do yourself the favor and get a larger tank. This tank is probably better for those that shoot mechanical/pump markers.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: Tank is great/glad to have it. Tank looks dented and marked like it was in a huge pile of air tanks or something... Tank is gloss black. Not black matte with large N and other markings shown in photo. Arrived May 2014. Hydro was done Oct 2013.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Very Unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive my HPA tank. Came super early, started shipping the moment I placed the order. The thing is...I spent $144.95 for a cheap Empire HPA tank? No, I ordered the Ninja 45 50 and instead opened the box to find I was ripped off very badly. It was in the Ninja box and everything, with the preferences marked on the side. I was shipped the wrong tank and it couldn't have been more wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Xyecon

customer_reviews.title: Durable and light solution
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful "peanut" tank that is durable (so far) and accommodates up to 4500 PSI. I really appreciate the small form factor and light wieght.
customer_reviews.author: Zeb Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this. It’s CRAP
customer_reviews.text: This tank is a leaking chunk of CRAP!!! I will never buy this cheap brand again.
customer_reviews.author: andre

customer_reviews.title: Item was hydro tested 8 months ago. Unacceptable. ...
customer_reviews.text: Item was hydro tested 8 months ago. Unacceptable. I've effectively lost almost a full season of paintball with this tank before i have to re-hydro.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product was defective after my first fill. Such a letdown...
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: NInja tank.
customer_reviews.text: Tank blew a burst Disc with less than 10 hours played, and I never filled above 2.2k PSI. BUY A CROSSFIRE OR A PURE ENERGY!
customer_reviews.author: Austin

product_meta.title: Ninja Paintball 4500 PSI Carbon Fiber HPA Tanks w/ Regulator
product_meta.description: Ninja makes the best quality and most reliable High Pressure Air paintball systems in the world. This is their 4500 psi line of Carbon fiber HPA systems.
feature_bullets: D.O.T. and T.C. approved carbon fiber bottle
Default output of 800 PSI to work out of the box with all Paintball Guns

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
